learning_outcomes.description: Understand, explain and apply the basic principles of clinical pathology pertinent to the veterinary technologist

Prepare for, perform and evaluate a range of diagnostic laboratory procedures including blood film preparation and basic appraisal, measurement of packed cell volume and total plasma protein, urinalysis, faecal analysis and dermatological techniques.

Be able to describe relevant clinical signs for common diseases, and important monitoring, treatment and nursing aspects of managing patients with renal, endocrine, gastrointestinal, dermatological and ophthalmic conditions.
Be able to describe relevant clinical signs for common diseases, and important monitoring, treatment and nursing aspects of veterinary emergency and critical care patients.
Be able to describe and manage key aspects of canine and feline reproduction
Be able to assist in designing preventative health programs for managing disease in dogs and cats

assessments.due_date:
Quiz 1 3/02/2026 - 4/02/2026

Quiz 2 12/02/2026 - 13/02/2026

Quiz 3 10/03/2026 - 11/03/2026

Quiz 4 24/03/2026 - 25/03/2026

Please see the course Blackboard Ultra site for specific due times.
assessments.task_description:
FOUR progressive online quizzes, on the topics of:

  • Renal medicine and urinalysis, including the urinalysis prac (5%)
  • Clinical pathology (haematology and clinical chemistry), including the haematology prac (5%)
  • Ophthalmology, including the ophthalmology prac (10%)
  • Preventative medicine (5%)


Each quiz will be open in Blackboard for 24 hours. TWO (2) attempts at each Quiz will be allowed. Quiz timings will be clearly gazetted on the course timetable on Blackboard Ultra. Each quiz shall comprise ten multiple choice questions (MCQ's) drawn randomly from a pool (0.5 mark per question). Questions may incorporate visual media.

Twenty minutes of working time is permitted per quiz, and the quiz must be completed in a single sitting.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI)  

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.due_date:
Urinary Practicum 28/01/2026

Haematology Practicum 4/02/2026

Please see the course Blackboard Ultra site for allocated student groups and times.
assessments.task_description:
These examinations will be held on campus as invigilated assessments during your scheduled practical classes.

  • Exam 1: Urinary Practicum (10%)
  • Exam 2: Haematology Practicum (10%)

Assessable items will be based on the content covered in the respective practicums. Preparation materials are available in the corresponding Blackboard Ultra folders.

Students are to remain in the assigned group. Tutor numbers are planned to ensure equal group sizes and fair supervision

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
The In-Semester Examination will be conducted via the Inspera platform and will be held during the central In-Semester Saturday Exam period.

All content taught during the semester is potentially examinable in the in-semester exam, including content previously examined in the quizzes. However, extra emphasis will be placed on content that was not previously examined in the quizzes.

Previous VETS3009 Inspera examinations are available in the library as an example of the different question types that can be utilised within this platform. 

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

learning_activities.topic:
Clinical Pathology

Five lectures covering veterinary clinical pathology, including sample collection/handling/submission, basic QA/QC, haematology, clinical chemistry and urinalysis with an emphasis on aspects relevant to the veterinary technician

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Clinical Pathology Five lectures covering veterinary clinical pathology, including sample collection/handling/submission, basic QA/QC, haematology, clinical chemistry and urinalysis with an emphasis on aspects relevant to the veterinary technician

learning_activities.topic:
Preventative Health Programs

Three lectures outlining preventative health strategies to promote small animal health.

Learning outcomes: L01, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Preventative Health Programs Three lectures outlining preventative health strategies to promote small animal health.

learning_activities.topic:
Transfusion Medicine & Shock

Two lectures canvassing applied aspects of transfusion medicine and shock.

Learning outcomes: L01, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Transfusion Medicine & Shock Two lectures canvassing applied aspects of transfusion medicine and shock.

learning_activities.topic:
Tick Paralysis

Two lectures canvassing the approach to managing a paralysis tick case

Learning outcomes: L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Tick Paralysis Two lectures canvassing the approach to managing a paralysis tick case

learning_activities.topic:
Practical Haematology

Session covering practical haematology skills, including blood film preparation and staining and measurement of PCV and TP.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Practical Haematology Session covering practical haematology skills, including blood film preparation and staining and measurement of PCV and TP.

learning_activities.topic:
Ophthalmology

Two lectures canvassing ophthalmic examination and ophthalmic nursing

Learning outcomes: L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Ophthalmology Two lectures canvassing ophthalmic examination and ophthalmic nursing

learning_activities.topic:
Small Animal Gastrointestinal System

Two lectures outlining clinical signs, case management and nursing aspects of common diseases of the gastrointestinal system

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Small Animal Gastrointestinal System Two lectures outlining clinical signs, case management and nursing aspects of common diseases of the gastrointestinal system

learning_activities.topic:
Renal/Urinary System

learning_activities.topic_description: Endocrine System Two lectures outlining clinical signs, case management and nursing aspects of common diseases of endocrine system

Practical exploring aspects of practice laboratory urinalysis workup, including dipstick evaluation, refractometry and sediment preparation

Learning outcomes: L05

Two lectures outlining clinical signs, case management including recumbent patient care, and nursing aspects of common emergency and critical care conditions.
